intro: Ledebouria sandersonii, commonly known as the Sanderson's bulbous lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous base and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
